sections.title: Navigating Our Discord Community
sections.content: Welcome to the FAQ thread! Here are answers to the most common questions about how Sandlot Picks operates and what you can expect from this community.

items.question: What does 'STD' or Standard Deviation mean on a prediction?
items.subtitle: I keep seeing STD next to the predictions ‚Äî what does that tell me as a bettor?
items.answer: STD stands for standard deviation. It helps you understand how consistent a prediction is compared to a player's previous performances.
list: Lower STD: More consistent, predictable performance
Higher STD: More volatile, less predictable

items.question: What does 'Edge' mean in the context of these picks?
items.subtitle: What's ' (+2.50) / (-2.50) '? Why does it matter to my decision-making?
items.answer: The 'edge' is shown next to the prediction, for example:
items.footer: This value represents the difference between our model's expected result and the actual betting line. A higher edge indicates greater value in the bet.

sections.title: Prediction Format
sections.description: Our predictions include several key components:

metrics.name: Edge Value
metrics.description: The difference between our model's prediction and the betting line. Higher edge = more value.

metrics.name: Confidence Score
metrics.description: How certain our model is about the prediction based on historical accuracy.

metrics.name: Standard Deviation (STD)
metrics.description: Measures consistency and volatility in player performance.

tips.title: Bankroll Management
items: Set aside a specific amount for betting (your bankroll)
Never bet more than 1-5% of your bankroll on a single bet
Don't chase losses by increasing bet sizes
Track all your bets to understand your performance

tips.title: Using Our Analytics
tips.description: How to incorporate our predictions into your strategy:
items: Use predictions as one factor, not the only factor
Prioritize bets with high confidence AND high edge
Consider standard deviation for consistency
Do your own research on recent news and injuries
Compare multiple sportsbooks for the best lines

tips.title: Responsible Gambling
items: Betting should be entertainment, not income
Set loss limits and stick to them
Never bet money you can't afford to lose
Take breaks and don't bet when emotional
Seek help if gambling becomes a problem: 1-800-GAMBLER

tips.title: Advanced Tips
items: Line shopping: Compare odds across multiple sportsbooks
Timing: Sometimes waiting for better lines pays off
Specialization: Focus on bet types you understand best
Record keeping: Track everything to identify your strengths
Community input: Learn from others in our Discord
